hdr_zrec_g_grad_dth_log2.description: This value represents threshold 2 for the green pixel gradient delta for directional interpolation.

hdr_zrec_rb_grad_dth_log2.description: This value represents threshold 2 for the red/blue pixel gradient delta for directional interpolation.

recon_edge_lpf_tap0.description: Tap0 value for low-pass filter applied before edge detection.

mac_motion_dilation.description: Size of motion dilation max filter, 5 means -5 to 5, i.e. 11-tap filter.

mac_motion0_dt0.description: An additive term to noise estimate, to avoid dividing by zero.

mac_smooth_enable.description: Enable motion adaptive smoothing, an optional step in MAC.

mac_smooth_tap0.description: Tap0 value for the low-pass filter in motion adaptive smoothing.

recon_min_factor.description: This value represents min to mid factor to force vertical edge direction

recon_flat_region_th.description: This value represents the threshold for the flat region in edge detection

recon_h_edge_th1.description: This value represents threshold 1 for the horizontal edge switching function

recon_h_edge_dth_log2.description: log2(th2-th1) for horizontal edge switching function.

recon_motion_th1.description: This value represents threshold 1 for the motion switching function.

recon_motion_dth_log2.description: Brief description: log2(th2-th1) for motion switching function.

recon_dark_th1.description: This value represents threshold 1 for dark noise switching function.

recon_dark_dth_log2.description: Brief description: log2(th2-th1) for dark noise switching function.

hdr_zrec_prefilt_tap0.description: This value represents the strength of the Zigzag HDR prefilter.

hdr_zrec_g_grad_th1.description: This value represents threshold 1 for the green pixel gradient for directional interpolation.

hdr_zrec_rb_grad_th1.description: This value represents threshold 1 for the red/blue pixel gradient for directional interpolation.

mac_motion0_th2.description: Noise model is: noise = th2*sqrt(gain*intensity)+th1. This value represents the noise-luma slope for motion detection.

mac_motion0_strength.description: This value represents the motion adaptation strength value.

mac_low_light_th1.description: This value represents the threshold 1 value for low light switching.

mac_low_light_strength.description: This value represents the log light switching strength value.

mac_high_light_th1.description: This value represents the threshold 1 value for high light switching.

mac_high_light_dth_log2.description: This value represents the log2(th2 ?th1) value for high light switching.
